lead_paragraph: Stories of extreme do-gooders are both inspiring and unnerving. So how altruistic must one be?
snippet: Stories of extreme do-gooders are both inspiring and unnerving. So how altruistic must one be?
abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column examines tendency among some people toward moral radicalism, in which they seek to address suffering in world, often with great zeal and at great personal expense; submits impersonal compassion such people exhibit is at odds with true intimacy, while their single-minded purity is at odds with nature of life; argues morality exists on continuum, and many shades are necessary for humane world.
